page.title: 10Tenants of Southwick
page.content: All farms and houses on the estate are owned by Mrs. Borthwick_Norton, they are let to tenant owners. Southwick has its own private water supply, and has a{'lay_peculiar' church,}which means that it is owned by Mrs.Borthwick_Norton. This is very rare, and there is only one other of its kind in the country. The Carter family have been tenants in Southwick for nearly 5OO years. {Mrs. Annie Carter}lives in the house today, and at{92}she is the village's oldest inhabitant. As the village is privately owned, all houses are let. There are no new buildings, because Mrs. Borthwick_Norton will not allow new buildings. This is an attempt to keep the village in its original form.
